## `tvthemes` : Themes and Color Palettes based on American TV Shows for `ggplot2` visualizations

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(tvthemes)
library(extrafont)
# import_univers()
# import_univers_extrablack()
import_champion_htf_heaveyweight()
loadfonts()

mtcars %>% 
  mutate(cyl = as_factor(cyl),
         carb = as_factor(carb)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(mpg, hp, fill = cyl)) +
  #geom_point(aes(color = carb), size = 2) +
  geom_point(size = 2, color = "#41b6c4") +
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = 100, xmax = 300, ymin = 200, ymax = 300)) +
  scale_color_brooklyn99() +
  scale_fill_brooklyn99() +
  labs(x = "horsepowerinho", y = "mile per gallones",
       title = "Well this package thing isn't going all dandy and sunshines") +
  theme_brooklyn99(font.text = "Roboto Condensed",
                   font.title = "Champion HTF-Heavyweight",
                   font.legend = "Helvetica")
```



```{r}
mtcars %>% 
  mutate(cyl = as_factor(cyl),
         carb = as_factor(carb)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(mpg, hp, fill = cyl)) +
  #geom_point(aes(color = carb), size = 2) +
  geom_col(fill = "#549E39") +
  geom_point(size = 2, color = "#41b6c4") +
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = 100, xmax = 300, ymin = 200, ymax = 300)) +
  theme(text = element_text(family = "Champion HTF-Heavyweight"),
        axis.text = element_text(size = 8),
        axis.title.y = element_text(angle = 0, vjust= 0.5),
        plot.background = element_rect(color = NA, fill = "#fcf7e8"),
        panel.background = element_rect(color = NA, fill = "#fcf7e8"),
        panel.grid.major.x = element_blank())
```



```{r}
mtcars %>% 
  mutate(cyl = as_factor(cyl),
         carb = as_factor(carb)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(mpg, hp)) +
  #geom_point(aes(color = carb), size = 2) +
  geom_col(fill = "#4C3114") + # "#549E39" lightgreen
  geom_point(size = 2, color = "#7A491E") +   #  #4C3114 darker brown
  geom_point(color = "yellow") +
  geom_point(color = "#fee0d2") +
  labs(title = "Parks and Recreation",

  theme(text = element_text(family = "Champion HTF-Heavyweight"),
        axis.text = element_text(size = 8, color = "grey20"),
        axis.title = element_text(color = "grey20"),
        plot.background = element_rect(color = NA, fill = "#CCFFBB"),#238443   #CCFFBB
        panel.background = element_rect(color = NA, fill = "#238443"), # #1A5E1FFF darkgreen  #238443
        panel.grid.major = element_line(color = "#fee0d2"),
        panel.grid.minor = element_line(color = "#fee0d2"))
```

```{r}
library(shadowtext)
library(glue)

header <- ggplot() +
  geom_shadowtext(aes(y = 3.15, x = 2,
           family = "Champion HTF-Heavyweight"), 
           color = "#fcf7e8", size = 50,
           label = glue("Parks & Recreation")) +
  # annotate(geom = "text", y = 3.15, x = 2, size = 50, 
  #          family = "Champion HTF-Heavyweight", color = "#fcf7e8",
  #          label = glue("Parks & Recreation")) +
  geom_shadowtext(aes(y = 3.15, x = 2,
           family = "Champion HTF-Heavyweight"), 
           color = "#fcf7e8", size = 25,
           label = glue("Parks & Recreation")) +
  # annotate(geom = "text", y = 2.5, x= 2, size = 25, 
  #          family = "Champion HTF-Heavyweight", color = "white",
  #          label= "Parks & Recreation") +
  ylim(0, 4) +
  theme_void() +
  theme(plot.background = element_rect(color = "#fcf7e8", 
                                       fill = "#005502", # "#1A5E1FFF" "#CCFFBB"
                                       size = 5))
header
```
